physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Voluminous, white, painful, nonpruritic tongue; diffuse angioedema of the floor of the mouth, bottom lip, and right side of the face and neck; moderate dyspnea and dysphagia with sialorrhea; no urticaria or hemodynamic compromise.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Angioedema stopped progressing 30 minutes after administration of C1-esterase inhibitor and tranexamic acid; began to decrease 1 hour after injection and resolved completely after 36 hours.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal C1INH levels and function; normal ACE levels; normal aminopeptidase P activity; two episodes of spontaneous lipedema in the past with resolution after a few hours.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: DPP-4 activity was normal one week after stopping sitagliptin therapy; the patient has not received sitagliptin or had new episodes of swelling since the exacerbation 4 years ago.
